page.title: 03LANDSCAPE
page.content: Mirfield lies in the valley floor and lower valley side of the River Calder. The valley floor is about 1/2 km wide. It is followed by the railway between Huddersfield and Leeds and the A644 to Dewsbury. Much of the older industry has been developed along the river and canal so that it is now polluted (to some extent).The main shopping area has a linear form along the A644 road to the north of the river.The housing on the north side is largely brick built semi-detached and detached.There are some small older terrace houses in the valley floor, built for the factory workers in the past. South of the river the steep valley sides have much woodland.There are also some farms and a golf course. Some larger houses lie in their own grounds and there are two small village settlements,Whitley and Briestfield.
